definitions.definition: a particular form in which a book, magazine, or newspaper is published:
examples: the paperback/hardback edition of the dictionary

definitions.definition: a single broadcast of a series of radio or television programmes:
examples: This morning's edition of 'Women's Hour' is at the earlier time of a quarter to ten.

definitions.definition: the total number of copies of a particular book, newspaper, etc. that are published at the same time:
examples: She collects first editions of 19th-century authors.

definitions.definition: one of a series of repeated events:
examples: The 77th edition of the Indianapolis 500 was held before an estimated 450,000 fans.
